comment: Dr. Flaggs is a decent professor. She allows for group discussions and gives feedback throughout the class on teaching techniques and math instruction. Follow the modules and complete everything, or your grade will suffer. Participation and asking clarifying questions is key.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Graded by few things

comment: Dr. Flaggs is one of my favorite professors at KSU.  She's very attentive, she is very informed on the topics, and I enjoy the energy she brings to the classroom everyday!

Vague Teaching and Poor Preparation.This sums up Dr. Flaggs' class.Weekly participation and assignments are loaded late each week and several large assignments loaded the last week of class. Overall, a poor experience that taught me very little about teaching mathematics. Assignments are not graded, nor is feedback received before the final grade.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: She's incredibly patronizing, lecture heavy, and unclear with any rubric. I've come to understand she wants students to mimic her. There is a 3 week project where we teach the class, and I got As once I realized she just wants us to mimic the way she teaches. BE LIKE HER. Play her game and you will get an A.

Her grading is so whack. You get a total of 100 participation points, if you miss 1 class you get 25 points deducted and you have to participate in class. Weekly practice explanations that she has the class critique during class. She calls people out in class. Her tests are split into two parts; one taken in class and one taken at home with webcam.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects

comment: Not clear, Gets a kick out of making students panic. Does not know how to answer material related questions. Def does not teach. Relies on students to teach the class. This class taught me nothing about teaching mathematics to my future students. Get ready to be accused of cheating constantly. Effort does not matter here.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects

comment: Dr. Flaggs is very sweet and the class is an easy A. Show up for class and do the work she give you and youll do fine.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Dr. Flaggs is super sweet and caring if you give 100%, but her class genuinely requires effort and participation. The textbook is online and provided, be prepared for discussions from reading (she really likes participation!!!) . Overall great lady just a lot of work. There is a midterm and a final
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects

comment: Dr. Flaggs was amazing, as long as you participate, read the book, and just show up, you will be totally fine.

Please save yourself. This class is made far too complicated for elementary material. The professor has said herself that her bachelor's area of study is where her work ethic mainly comes from. A strict, fast-paced work ethic simply not necessary for this course. Nice lady with no negative intentions but no need to make a mountain of an ant hill.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--So many papers

comment: Do not take this professor's class. I had to work incredibly hard for my grade. She makes the most simplistic topics hard and complicated. This class stressed me out more than my more academically advanced classes. She has a strict attendance and no cell phone policy. Also, make sure to particpate all semester.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: She goes over the top sometimes, but this doesn't warrant giving her 1 star. She was the easiest person to talk to. She showed up enthusiastic to class everyday, and is strict on cell phone usage (not allowed). I did minimum studying, but put more effort into projects. Last project is the final exam grade. VERY lenient grader, extra credit offered

What everyone is saying is true. She always did the most when things were so simple. The material is common sense and straightforward. Make sure to read and take notes on the chapters for the quizzes and in class discussion. If you miss three classes, it's a letter grade off. However, she does care about students and you can easily BS assignments.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: This class is mandatory, but taking this teacher is not, nor is it advised. She's a nice person, but takes a simple intro class entirely too seriously. The projects based on the material are overly detailed and unnecessarily complicated, and the projects get piled on one after the other. Taking this teacher WILL stress you out. Beware!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Very nice lady, but takes the class too seriously. Its a seminar class and she thinks its as important as like a math class. I took 4 class this semester and this was the only one I was worried about failing.

She makes you read way more than you need to and expects you to memorize every little detail for quizzes and tests. She takes everything in the book way too serious and none of it has been helpful so far. I have done more homework for this class than any other. Taking this professor will put you under way more stress than this class should.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: She is a nice teacher but make sure you read the online textbook for the class because she will ask questions straight from the book and create quizzes based off the book. There are a lot of assignments and projects in her class but she is lenient if you need an extension or extra time for the assignments. Also, make sure you participate in class!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Worst class ever. Did way more work in this class than all my other classes combined... (Including Calc I) Takes the the material way too seriously. This should have been more of a common sense type of class but Dr. Flaggs blew it out of proportion. All the material learned in this class has not helped me in any way possible. DONOTTAKETHISPROF
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES
